metadata.title: CVE-2017-5549 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The klsi_105_get_line_state function in drivers/usb/serial/kl5kusb105.c inthe Linux kernel before 4.9.5 places uninitialized heap-memory contentsinto a log entry upon a failure to read the line status, which allows localusers to obtain sensitive information by reading the log.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5549` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-157-generic - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-lowlatency - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-157-generic - 3.13.0-157.207
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-63-generic - 4.4.0-63.84~14.04.2
linux-image-4.4.0-63-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-63.84~14.04.2
linux-image-4.4.0-63-lowlatency - 4.4.0-63.84~14.04.2
linux-image-4.4.0-63-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-63.84~14.04.2
linux-image-4.4.0-63-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-63.84~14.04.2
linux-image-4.4.0-63-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-63.84~14.04.2
linux-image-4.4.0-63-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-63.84~14.04.2
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-63-generic - 4.4.0-63.84~14.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-157.207').

linux-lts-vivid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-63.84~14.04.2').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
